metadata.Title: CVE-2017-10978 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
An FR-GV-201 issue in FreeRADIUS 2.x before 2.2.10 and 3.x before 3.0.15 allows "Read / write overflow in make_secret()" and a denial of service.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-10978` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

freeradius - 2.2.8+dfsg-0.1ubuntu0.1
freeradius-common - 2.2.8+dfsg-0.1ubuntu0.1
freeradius-iodbc - 2.2.8+dfsg-0.1ubuntu0.1
freeradius-krb5 - 2.2.8+dfsg-0.1ubuntu0.1
freeradius-ldap - 2.2.8+dfsg-0.1ubuntu0.1
freeradius-mysql - 2.2.8+dfsg-0.1ubuntu0.1
freeradius-postgresql - 2.2.8+dfsg-0.1ubuntu0.1
freeradius-utils - 2.2.8+dfsg-0.1ubuntu0.1
libfreeradius2 - 2.2.8+dfsg-0.1ubuntu0.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: freeradius package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.2.8+dfsg-0.1ubuntu0.1').
